Introduction.Description: The Lizardmen, sometimes known as the Cold Ones or the Children of the Gods, are an ancient, savage, intelligent race of cold-blooded, reptilian humanoids that were at one time the first and oldest civilisation of the Warhammer World. Long before the rise of Men, Elf or Dwarf, the empire of the Lizardmen ruled supreme.\n\nAlien, enigmatic, and without mercy, the Lizardmen were there when it all began and will be there when the world draws its last dying breath, never tiring nor relenting until order is finally restored to this uncaring, chaotic world. Such is what they were made to do, for they are the ancient servants of the Old Ones, the one true protectors of this very world

Magic.Name: The Lore of Heaven
Magic.Options: High Magic or any of eight Lore of Battle Magic
Magic.Enemy: Warriors of Chaos, The Lore of Nurgle

Powers.Name: Reservoir of Eldritch Energy
Powers.Rule: At the end of the opponent's Magic phase, the Slann Mage-Priest can store a single unused dispel dice remaining in your pool. At the beginning of your next Magic phase, roll a D6; on a 2+ you can add that dice to your power pool (this cannot take your power pool beyond the normal limit). On the roll of a 1, that bonus dice is lost. If the Slann is slain before his next Magic phase, the bonus dice is lost

Powers.Name: Soul of Stone
Powers.Rule: When rolling on the Miscast table, the Slann Mage-Priest can choose to subtract one from the result (to a minimum of 2), or add one to the result (to a maximum of 12), instead of accepting the original result

Powers.Name: Becalming Cogitation
Powers.Rule: The Slann Mage-Priest re-rolls its first failed dispel attempt in each Magic phase

Powers.Name: Wandering Deliberations
Powers.Rule: Instead of generating spells normally, the Slann Mage-Priest knows the signature spell for each of the eight lores of Battle Magic. This discipline cannot be combined with the Focus of Mystery discipline
Powers.Description: Instead of generating spells normally, the Slann Mage-Priest knows the signature spell for each of the eight lores of Battle Magic. This discipline cannot be combined with the Focus of Mystery discipline

Powers.Name: Harmonic Convergence
Powers.Rule: The Slann Mage-Priest rolls two additional dice whenever he attempts to channel power or dispel dice

Powers.Name: The Harrowing Scrutiny
Powers.Description: The Slann Mage-Priest has the Terror special rule

Powers.Name: Transcendent Healing
Powers.Rule: If this model is alive at the end of any friendly Magic phase, roll a number of D6 equal to the difference between the Slann Mage-Priest's starting number of Wounds and its current number of Wounds. For each roll of a 6, the Slann Mage-Priest immediately recovers a single Wound lost earlier in the battle

Powers.Name: Unfathomable Presence
Powers.Rule: Roll a D3 at the start of each enemy Magic phase; the Slann Mage-Priest has the Magic Resistance(x) special rule until the end of that phase, where x is the result of the D3

Powers.Name: Focus of Mystery
Powers.Rule: The Slann Mage-Priest has the Loremaster (Lore of High Magic) special rule. This discipline cannot be combined with the Wandering Deliberations discipline
Powers.Description: The Slann Mage-Priest has the Loremaster (Lore of High Magic) special rule. This discipline cannot be combined with the Wandering Deliberations discipline

Powers.Name: Higher State of Consciousness
Powers.Rule: The Slann Mage-Priest has the Ethereal and Unstable special rules, but cannot join units

Weapon.Name: The Blade of Realities
Weapon.Description: No armour or ward saves can be taken against Wounds caused by the Blade of Realities

Weapon.Name: The Piranha Blade
Weapon.Description: The wielder has the Multiple Wounds (D3) and Armour Piercing special rules

Additional.Name: Sacred Stegadon Helm of Itza
Additional.Description: The wearer of the Sacred Stegadon Helm counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. Furthermore, the Sacred Stegadon Helm grants the wearer +1 Toughness and the Impact Hits (D3) special rule

Banner.Name: Skavenpelt Banner
Banner.Description: All models in a unit with the Skavenpelt Banner gain the Frenzy and Hatred (Skaven) special rules. However, all skaven models gain the Hatred special rule while attacking the bearer

Banner.Name: The Jaguar Standard
Banner.Rule: All models in a unit with the Jaguar Standard have the Swiftstride special rule

Arcane.Name: Cube of Darkness
Arcane.Rule: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard with the Cube of Darkness can use it instead of attempting to dispel the spell using dispel dice. If he does so, roll a D6; on the roll of a 2+ the spell is automatically dispelled - otherwise the spell is resolved as normal. In either case, roll a separate D6 for every Remains in Play spell currendy in effect; on a 2+ that spell automatically ends

Arcane.Name: Plaque of Dominion
Arcane.Rule: Bound spell (power level 3). The Plaque of Dominion contains a hex spell that targets all enemy Wizards within 18". The targets of this spell have the Stupidity special rule until the start of the caster's next Magic phase

Armour.Name: The Cloak of Feathers
Armour.Description: Skink character on foot only. The wearer of the Cloak of Feathers has the Fly special rule. In addition, the wearer has the Magic Resistance (1) special rule

Armour.Name: The Horn of Kygor
Armour.Rule: One use only. The bearer of the Horn of Kygor can sound it at the start of any of his Movement phases. If he does so, all friendly monsters, monster mounts, monstrous beasts, monstrous cavalry mounts, cavalry mounts, chariot beasts and war beasts within 12" of the bearer have the Frenzy special rule until the start of their next Movement phase
Armour.Description: One use only. The bearer of the Horn of Kygor can sound it at the start of any of his Movement phases. If he does so, all friendly monsters, monster mounts, monstrous beasts, monstrous cavalry mounts, cavalry mounts, chariot beasts and war beasts within 12" of the bearer have the Frenzy special rule until the start of their next Movement phase. Note that the Horn of Kygor has no effect on riders, just their mounts

Weapon.Name: The Egg of Quango
Weapon.Rule: One use only. The Egg of Quango can be cracked open at the start of any Close Combat phase. Nominate one enemy unit in base contact with the bearer or his unit, roll a D6 and consult the table below to find out what happens
Weapon.Description:
One use only. The Egg of Quango can be cracked open at the start of any Close Combat phase. Nominate one enemy unit in base contact with the bearer or his unit, roll a D6 and consult the table below to find out what happens. Any Wounds inflicted count towards combat results.

D6 - Result
1 - The egg opens and a withered Quango hatchling bites the enemy feebly before dying of old age. The enemy unit immediately suffers D6 Strength 3 hits.
2-3 - A Quango hatchling emerges to bite the enemy with vigour before succumbing to its extreme age. The enemy unit immediately suffers D6 Strength 4 hits.
4-6 - The heavens resound to thunderous peals as a Quango, bursts forth in full glory and casts its radiant hues upon the world. After smiting its foes, it flies off, taking no further part in the battle. The enemy unit immediately suffers 2D6 Strength 5 hits

Additional.Name: Helm of Discord
Additional.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. In addition, at the start of each Close Combat phase, choose an enemy character in base contact with the bearer or his unit. That character must immediately take a Leadership test. If the test is failed, the character succumbs to the helm's sibilant whispers of malice and jealousy. In this Close Combat phase, the victim cannot make attacks and is hit automatically

Lord.Name: Lord Mazadamundi
Lord.Description: Lord Mazadamundi, Lord of the Solar-City

Original.Rule: At the start of each friendly Magic phase, before dice are rolled to determine the strength of the Winds of Magic, you may pick two friendly Wizards with this special rule anywhere on the battlefield and they may exchange a single spell with each other. In subsequent turns, a different pairing of Wizards with this special rule may be chosen
Knows all the spells from his chosen Lore of Magic
Re-rolls its first failed dispel attempt in each Magic phase
Rolls two additional dice whenever he attempts to channel power or dispel dice
When rollint on the Miscast table, can choose to subtract one from the result or add one to the result

If this model is alive at the end of any friendly Magic phase, roll a number of D6 equal to the difference between the Slann Mage-Priest's starting number of Wounds and its current number of Wounds. For each roll of a 6, the Slann Mage-Priest immediately recovers a single Wound lost earlier in the battle.
Flammable

Knows only one spell - The Deliverance of Itza: a direct damage spell that targets all enemy units within 12". Each target suffers 2D6 Strength 4 hits. If a target has the Daemonic, Undead or Nehekharan Undead special rule, it suffers 3D6 hits instead
If Lord Kroak joins a unit of Temple Guard, all models in the combined unit gain the Unbreakable special rule
Lord Kroak can cast The Deliverance of Itza as many times per turn as he has sufficient power dice
Lord Kroak's Wizard level can never be reduced to less than 1

HandWeapon.Name: Hand of Gods
HandWeapon.Rule: Bound spell (power level 3). Hand of Gods contains the spell Shem's Burning Gaze

Original.Rule: Use Lore of Beast
A Slann Mage-Priest can choose to cast any magic missile or direct damage spell through a model with this special rule within 24" of him
Unless mounted, Tehenhauin can join Jungle Swarm units, even though characters are not normally permitted to join Swarms. Whilst Tehenhauin leads a Jungle Swarm, he gains the Unbreakable
If your army includes Tehenhauin, all Skinks in army (not their mounts or any Kroxigor) have the Hatred (Skaven) special rule

Unless mounted, in close combat Tehenhauin can make an extra D6 Attacks at Initiative 1. These extra Attacks are always resolved at Weapon Skill 2 and Strength 2 and have the Poisoned Attacks special rule

Can always re-roll failed Dangerous Terrain tests. Additionally, while they have the troop type Infantry, they are never considered to be 'models on foot' for the purposes of spells, magic items and special rules

At the start of each friendly Magic phase, before dice are rolled to determine the strength of the Winds of Magic, you may pick two friendly Wizards with this special rule anywhere on the battlefield and they may exchange a single spell with each other
Whilst Chakax is part of a combined unit that contains both a model with the Mage-Priest Palanquin special rule and Temple Guard, all models in the combined unit gain the Unbreakable special rule.
Chakax must always issue a challenge, and can never refuse one

HandWeapon.Name: The Star-stone Mace
HandWeapon.Rule: At the start of every Close Combat phase, all enemy models in base contact with Chakax must reveal their magic items. If Chakax scores one or more hits against a model with any magic items, roll a D6; on a 5+ one randomly determined magic item is immediately destroyed and cannot be used further in this game

Armour.Name: The Helm of Prime Guardian
Armour.Rule: Enemy units with the Scouts special rule may not use their special deployment to set up within 20" of Chakax
If an enemy unit within 20" of Chakax contains 'hidden' models, their presence must be announced as soon as they come within 20" of Chakax

Armour.Name: The Shield of Aeons
Armour.Rule: Any enemy model that makes a successful charge against Gor-Rok and ends the Movement phase in base contact with him must immediately take a Dangerous Terrain test with a -1 penalty

Original.Rule: Use Lore of Heavens
A Slann Mage-Priest can choose to cast any magic missile or direct damage spell through a model with this special rule within 24" of him
Knows all the spells from spells from the Lore of Heavens

Roll a D6 at the start of each friendly Magic phase. On a roll of 1, all friendly Wizards casting a spell must re-roll any of the power dice that roll a 6 this phase, but on a roll of 2-6, all friendly Wizards must re-roll power dice rolls of a 1 this phase

HandWeapon.Name: The Stellar Staff
HandWeapon.Rule: If Tetto'eko successfully casts the spell Comet of Casandora (see Lore of Heavens), you may re-roll the dice at the start of each Magic phase to see if the comet arrives

Armour.Name: Monor Shield of the Old Ones
Eye of the Old Ones
Armour.Rule: After deployment, but before Vanguard moves are made, if Tetto'eko is on the battlefield he can consult the Eye of the Old Ones. If he does so, D3 friendly units of your choice gain the Vanguard special rule

Armour.Name: The Palanquin of Constellations
Armour.Rule: Can always re-roll failed Dangerous Terrain tests

SpecialRules.Original: If your army contains Tiktaq'to, one unit of Terradon Riders can be upgraded to have the Ambushers special rule

HandWeapon.Name: Blade of Ancient Skies
HandWeapon.Rule: When fighting against a model with the Fly special rule, attacks made receive a +1 bonus To Hit

Armour.Name: Mask of Heavens
Armour.Rule: All Terradons in Tiktaq'to's unit use his Weapon Skill instead of their own
Enemy units suffer an additional -1 To Hit penalty when shooting Tiktaq'to and his unit

Original.Rule: Sniper
Enemy units shooting at a unit of Chameleon Skinks suffer an additional -1 To Hit. Missile weapons that do not roll To Hit are unaffected

If Oxyotl remained stationary in his preceding Movement phase, shots made from the Golden Blowpipe of P'Toohee in the Shooting phase wound automatically on any successful To Hit roll of a 5+ (no separate roll To Wound is necessary)

SpecialRules.Original: A Slann Mage-Priest can choose to cast any magic missile or direct damage spell through a model with this special rule within 24" of him

Once per game, during the Remaining Moves sub-phase, select one unengaged enemy unit that the Terradons moved over in that turn. That target immediately suffers D3 Strength 4 hits for each Terradon in the unit, distributed as for shooting attacks

Once per game, during the Remaining Moves sub-phase, select one unengaged enemy unit that the Terradons moved over in that turn. That target immediately suffers D3 Strength 4 hits for each Terradon in the unit, distributed as for shooting attacks

Original.Rule: If Kroq-Gar is ever killed, Grymloq automatically passes his Monster Reaction test and immediately becomes subject to Frenzy. In addition, Grymloq never loses his Frenzy
Swiftstride

SpecialRules.Original: Whilst they are part of a combined unit that has been joined by a model with the Mage-Priest Palanquin special rule, all Temple Guard models in the combined unit have the Stubborn and Immune to Psychology special rules.

Original.Rule: Swarm
Whilst an enemy unit is in base contact with one or more Jungle Swarms, all close combat attacks directed against the enemy have the Poisoned Attacks special rule

SpecialRules.Original: Enemy units shooting at a unit of Chameleon Skinks suffer an additional -1 To Hit. Missile weapons that do not roll To Hit are unaffected

Once per game, during the Remaining Moves sub-phase, select one unengaged enemy unit that the Terradons moved over in that turn. That target immediately suffers D3 Strength 4 hits for each Terradon in the unit, distributed as for shooting attacks

Original.Rule: For the purposes of calculating combat result bonuses, a Bastiladon counts as having no flanks or rear

Before rolling To Hit, nominate one of the Bastiladon's Attacks as the Thunderous Bludgeon (a different coloured dice works best). This Attack is resolved at Strength 10 and receives a +1 To Hit bonus against models in the creature's rear arc

SpecialRules.Original: Before the game starts, but after Scouts have been deployed, a Lustrian blot toad marker can be placed for each unit of Ripperdactyl Riders in your army. A single blot toad marker can be placed on any enemy unit on the tabletop, this marker remains throughout the battie

Original.Rule: A unit consists of a number of monstrous beasts and infantry handlers. Although they are monstrous beasts and not monsters, they follow all the rules for Monsters and Handlers, as described in the Warhammer rulebook
Spout Flames Attacks

A unit consists of a number of monstrous beasts and infantry handlers. Although they are monstrous beasts and not monsters, they follow all the rules for Monsters and Handlers, as described in the Warhammer rulebook
If charged, a Razordon Hunting Pack must Stand and Shoot if it is able to do so. However, when calculating the number of shots fired, each Razordon can re-roll the artillery dice
Shoot Barbs attacks
A Slann Mage-Priest can choose to cast any magic missile or direct damage spell through a model with this special rule within 24" of him

Once per battle, at the start of any friendly Close Combat phase, a Troglodon can unleash its Primeval Roar. This affects the Troglodon, and all friendly units within 12". All models in these units that have the Predatory Fighter special rule gain an additional Attack on any successful To Hit roll of a 5 or 6 (instead of just a 6) until the end of the phase
Spit Venom shooting attack
